column1: #Text=A polycrystalline sample of La3 [WO6] 1 \[VS6/2] was prepared by a conventional solid-state reaction technique using La2O3 (99.99%, Alfa Aesar), V (99.5%, Alfa Aesar), W (99.9%, Alfa Aesar), WO3 (99.8%, Alfa Aesar), and S (99.5%, Alfa Aesar) as starting materials.
#Text=The constituents were homogenized in an agate mortar and pressed into pellets under inert conditions inside an argon glovebox (MBraun Labmaster DP).
#Text=These pellets were put into a corundum crucible within a silica tube.
#Text=Subsequently, the silica tube was sealed having an internal pressure of 200 mbar of argon.
#Text=The sample was heated to 1150 °C and held at this temperature for 55 h.
#Text=The pellets became a powder and were reground to ensure good homogeneity.
#Text=In powder form the sample was re-reacted twice at the same temperature but for 10 h with intermediate grindings.
#Text=Small crystals of La3 [WO6] 1 \ [VS6/2] were grown in a KCl melt using La2O3, V, W, WO3 and S as starting materials.
#Text=The reagents were funnelled into a silica tube directly, heated to 950 °C, and maintained for 50 h.
#Text=Subsequently, the mixture was cooled down to 500 °C during 50 h and allowed to cool to the room temperature at an ambient rate.
